intro: Glochidion pinnatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its simple, opposite, and often narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Glochidion pinnatum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its fruits are capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds, facilitating wind dispersal.
